title: I Pitches
stimulusHtml:
16 points

The intent of this question was to test students’ ability to hear a traditional harmonic progression in the major mode, to notate its soprano and bass lines, and to provide a Roman-numeral analysis with necessary figured-bass numbers. The mean score was 12.19 out of a possible 24 points.

Pitches (16 points)

  • Award 1 point for each correctly notated pitch. Do not consider duration.

  • Award full credit for octave transpositions of the correct bass pitch. (Octave transpositions of soprano pitches are not allowed.)

  • No enharmonic equivalents are allowed.

title: II Chord Symbols
stimulusHtml:
Chord Symbols (8 points)

  • Award 1 point for each chord symbol correct in both Roman and Arabic numerals.

  • Award 1/2 point for each correct Roman numeral that has an incorrect or missing Arabic numeral.

  • Accept the correct Roman numeral regardless of its case.

  • The cadential 6-4 may be correctly notated in two different ways, as shown in the key above. If the Roman numeral of Chord X is V, the space below Chord Y should (1) contain an Arabic figure, (2) be blank or contain a dash, or (3) contain a V, in order for Chord X to receive any credit.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the following points:

Chord Symbols (8 points)

  • Award 1 point for each chord symbol correct in both Roman and Arabic numerals.

  • Award 1/2 point for each correct Roman numeral that has an incorrect or missing Arabic numeral.

  • Accept the correct Roman numeral regardless of its case.

  • The cadential 6-4 may be correctly notated in two different ways, as shown in the key above. If the Roman numeral of Chord X is V, the space below Chord Y should (1) contain an Arabic figure, (2) be blank or contain a dash, or (3) contain a V, in order for Chord X to receive any credit.

title: III Special Scoring Issues
stimulusHtml:
III. Special Scoring Issues

Round any fractional score up to the next higher point. (Exception: round 23½ DOWN.)

0 Score for responses that represent an unsuccessful attempt to answer the question.
descriptions:
III. Special Scoring Issues

Round any fractional score up to the next higher point. (Exception: round 23½ DOWN.)

0 Score for responses that represent an unsuccessful attempt to answer the question.
